turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Neurovax.
turn.1: What is the basic function of Neurovax?
turn.2: Neurovax Neurovax is a vaccine designed to treat patients with multiple sclerosis.
turn.4: Developed by Immune Response BioPharma, Inc.
turn.5: Was it already approved or was it still in trials?
turn.6: it is currently in phase II clinical trials.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Neurovax is designed to stimulate FOXP3+ regulatory T-cells that can then suppress the autoreactive T-cells in some patients.
turn.10: The development program for Neurovax terminated in 2008, when the company developing this vaccine was filed for bankruptcy.
turn.11: Was there any other company involved in the making of this vaccine?
turn.12: All work with Neurovax is now being developed by Immune Response BioPharma , Inc.
